label: 法隆寺
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōryūji (J.) 法隆寺, sometimes referred to as 法隆学問寺、斑鳩寺、鵤寺 Hōryūgakumondera, Ikarugadera, Ikarugadera. Temple constructed through the sponsorship of the reigning empress Suiko and prince Shōtoku in 607, and which features the best preserved art and architecture of early Japan. Originally of the Hossō school, Hōryūji is best known for its tradition of Shōtoku worship (太子信仰 Taishi shinkō), its artifacts, and its massive collection of manuscripts, which have yet to be studied in detail.
